org.hayabaya.loopers

Class Loopers

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.hayabaya.loopers.Loopers
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    LoopersDouble, LoopersDoubleBoxed, LoopersFloat, LoopersFloatBoxed, LoopersInt, LoopersIntegerBoxed, LoopersLong, LoopersLongBoxed

    public abstract class Loopers
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract class encapsulating the parts of JVM profiling that does not depend on the specific datatype. Because generics and other advanced features are not available for primitive data types such as int, long, float and double, it is necessary to use a lot of child classes that handles each data type specificially.

    • Field Detail

      • type

        protected Tpe type

    • Constructor Detail

      • Loopers

        protected Loopers()

      • Loopers

        public Loopers(Tpe type)
        Primary constructor of the parent class, called from a child class when they are being instantiated. The specific child class implements the abstract initializeArrayElements(int) method to do the actual initialization of the arrays.
        Parameters:
        type - The specific datatype of a given child class

    • Method Detail

      • getType

        public abstract Tpe getType()
        Override method in the data type specific sub-class implementations.
        Returns:
        Tpe the type of numerical representation that is tested.

      • initializeArrayElements

        protected abstract void initializeArrayElements(int arrayLength)
        Initialize the array with random values. This is not done generically, in order to explicity profile primitive operations.
        Parameters:
        arrayLength - The length of the array

      • makeResults

        public Results[] makeResults(Operation parsedOperation)
        For each length of the arrays, CycleNumbers and type of operation call performOperation(Operation) which starts the JVM timer and then calls operateLoop(Operation).
        Parameters:
        parsedOperation - The operation to be used on the array for the benchmark
        Returns:
        A result datastructure

      • performOperation

        protected long performOperation(Operation operation)
        This is where the core computations are actually performed; by calling it from performOperation which measures the computation time, the child classes will deal with the data type specific implementations of computing on the arrays.
        Parameters:
        operation - The type of operation to perform (+,-,/,*) on the array for n cycles
        Returns:
        The time it took to perform the operation in milliseconds

      • getArrayLength

        public final int getArrayLength()

      • setArrayLength

        public final void setArrayLength(int arrayLength)
        Set the length of an array in a Loopers object to a new length. This method is used for testing the different arraylengths specified in RunSettings. The method uses initializeArrayElements(int) of the specific child classes to re-initialize a new array.
        Parameters:
        arrayLength - The length of the new array to be initialized

      • getCurrentCycleNumber

        public final int getCurrentCycleNumber()

      • setCycles

        public final void setCycles(int cycles)
        Sets the currentCycleNumber to a new value.
        Parameters:
        cycles - The new number of cycles to run on an array

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
